= getword =

== Syntax ==
 string := getword( var input_string : string );

== Parameters ==
 input_string : string
    A string containing one or more words separated by spaces. This parameter is passed by reference and will be modified.

== Return Value ==
 string
    Returns the first word from the input string.
    Returns fail if the input string is null or invalid.

== Description ==
 The getword() function extracts the first word from a string and removes it from the original string. The function treats spaces as word separators and skips any leading spaces before finding the first word.

 Important: The input_string parameter is modified by this function - the returned word is removed from the original string. This makes getword() useful for parsing command arguments sequentially.

== Example ==
 dilbegin parse_command(cmd_line : string);
 var
    first_word : string;
    remaining : string;
 code
 {
    first_word := getword(cmd_line);
    remaining := cmd_line; // cmd_line now has the first word removed
    
    sendtext("First word: " + first_word + "&n", self);
    sendtext("Remaining: " + remaining + "&n", self);
    
    // Example with "cast fireball monster"
    // first_word becomes "cast"
    // remaining becomes "fireball monster"
    
    quit;
 } dilend

 dilbegin process_spell_args();
 var
    spell_name : string;
    target_name : string;
 code
 {
    spell_name := getword(argument);
    target_name := getword(argument);
    
    if (spell_name == "") {
       sendtext("Cast what?&n", self);
       quit;
    }
    
    if (target_name == "") {
       sendtext("Cast " + spell_name + " on whom?&n", self);
       quit;
    }
    
    sendtext("Casting " + spell_name + " on " + target_name + "&n", self);
    quit;
 } dilend
